page.title: 16RELIGION
page.content: { {St Mary the Virgin Greywell} The church was built in 1117 by the Normans it is small with lovely pews in the nave.It is made of a mixture of brick flint and stone. There is still a Norman dooron the north side. There are four bells in the tower and three of them are inscribed. There is a lovely arch. There is a 1567 chalice in the church. {St Stephens This Norman church was built of brick,flint, stone and wood. The two bell in the tower were made in 1715 and 1760. The roof is made of wood and tiles. In 1844 the whole church was refitted. There is still a gaslamp on the wall. There is 12th century font.
